author: Tim Stelloh
description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth ordered the removal of 2,000 National Guard troops who were mobilized in response to protests in Los Angeles last month over immigration raids, a Pentagon official said Tuesday."Thanks to our troops who stepped up to answer the call, the lawlessness in Los Angeles is subsiding," chief Pentagon spokesman Sean Parnell said in a statement.
title: Pete Hegseth orders the removal of 2,000 National Guard troops from Los Angeles

author: Deon J. Hampton
description: An independent autopsy determined that no exit wound or bullet was found in the body of an 18-year-old Black college freshman who was fatally shot by a police officer in Alabama, his family's attorney said Tuesday
title: Family wants to know why student was fatally shot by an Alabama police officer

author: The Politics Desk
description: President Donald Trump is setting a lofty goal for Texas Republicans as they prepare to tackle redrawing their congressional maps.
title: Trump's Texas-sized redistricting dreams: From the Politics Desk

author: Tim Stelloh
description: The Minnesota man accused of fatally shooting the state’s former house speaker in what authorities have described as a politically motivated assassination claimed that the state's governor wanted him to kill two U.S. senators, officials said Tuesday
title: Vance Boelter indicted on federal murder charges in the killing of Minnesota lawmaker and her husband

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: Under new Trump administration guidance, millions of immigrants who entered the U.S. without legal authorization would have to fight their deportation cases in detention.
title: ICE bars detained immigrants from getting bond hearings

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: ICE detained an expectant father in Washington state just months before his wife is scheduled to give birth
title: ICE detains father in Washington state; pregnant wife pleads, 'I just want him home'

author: Sahil Kapur
description: WASHINGTON — Senate Republicans are making changes to a $9.4 billion package of spending cuts proposed by President Donald Trump as they race to pass the measure by a Friday deadline
title: Senate Republicans shrink Trump's spending cut package ahead of a key vote

author: David K. Li
description: A former college football player ran down a suspected arsonist, and Los Angeles firefighters tackled hillside flames before the burning brush could get out of control, officials said Tuesday
title: Suspected Los Angeles arsonist run down by former college football player

author: Joe Kottke
description: A transgender girl housed in a male unit of a Washington, D.C., juvenile detention center has been hospitalized after sustaining multiple injuries, including a broken jaw, officials said.
title: Trans girl housed in male unit has jaw broken at D.C. juvenile detention center

author: The Associated Press
description: Some legal experts and property managers say the demands they reviewed pose serious legal questions because they're not signed by a judge and may violate a housing discrimination law.
title: Immigration authorities demand landlords turn over tenant information

description: Attorney General Pam Bondi declined to answer questions about the Justice Department's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. President Donald Trump has defended Bondi after the DOJ released a memo stating there was no evidence of a "client list" related to Epstein.
title: Bondi declines to answer question about Epstein investigation

description: Nominees for the 77th Emmy Awards were announced with the television show "Severance" leading the field with 27 nominations. USA Today host Ralphie Aversa details the nominees and which shows were notably snubbed.
title: 'Severance' dominates Emmy nominations with 27 nods

author: Fiona Bork
description: The number of structures at risk of flooding in the United States could be higher than previously thought, according to a study published Monday
title: New study targets past flooding as key to helping property owners assess climate threats

author: The Associated Press
description: The Rev. John MacArthur, an influential and exacting evangelical preacher, died Monday at the age of 86
title: Influential evangelical preacher John MacArthur dies at 86

author: Viola Flowers
description: Popular YoCrunch yogurt products are being voluntarily recalled following consumer reports of plastic pieces in the dome topper that could potentially cause choking, parent company Danone U.S. announced Tuesday.
title: YoCrunch yogurts recalled over potential choking risk from plastic pieces

author: Brooke Sopelsa
description: Texas lawmakers will convene next week for a special session to consider legislation addressing the deadly floods that devastated parts of the state earlier this month — and a bill regarding which restrooms transgender Texans can use.
title: Transgender bathroom bill added to Texas flood-relief special session

description: President Trump continued to defend Attorney General Pam Bondi for her handling of a report on the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and said he thinks she should release "whatever she thinks is credible" to the public.
title: Trump: Bondi should release 'whatever she thinks is credible' on Epstein

author: Doha Madani
description: Former MLB pitcher Danny Serafini was found guilty of murder and attempted murder of his wife's parents in a 2021 Lake Tahoe attack, where he waited inside their home with a gun in what prosecutors say was a financially motivated killing.
title: Former MLB pitcher found guilty of murdering father-in-law in 2021 Lake Tahoe attack

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: Fyre Festival has sold the rights to the troubled brand, including its IP, brand trademarks, and social media assets, on eBay Tuesday for a paltry $245,300
title: Fyre Festival sells troubled brand for $245K on eBay

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: Television personality Chip Gaines defended the inclusion of a same-sex couple in “Back to the Frontier,” a new show featuring him and his wife, Joanna, about families who give up technology and try to live as homesteaders did in the 1800s.
title: Chip Gaines defends decision to include gay couple on 'Back to the Frontier' show

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump travels to Pennsylvania to take part in the inaugural Pennsylvania Energy and Innovation Summit at Carnegie Mellon University.
title: Trump participates in energy and innovation summit in Pennsylvania

author: The Associated Press
description: Baseball Commissioner Rob Manfred and players' union head Tony Clark say plans are moving ahead exploring the possibility of using major leaguers in the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics, a tournament that could be played on an extended All-Star break.
title: MLB open to letting players take part in 2028 Olympics

author: Scott Wong
description: WASHINGTON — Some conservative Republicans in Congress are breaking with President Donald Trump's handling of the case of the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, the latest development in a rare MAGA revolt against the administration
title: Some conservatives in Congress break with Trump on his handling of the Epstein files

author: Reuters
description: An ancient Roman erotic mosaic depicting has returned to Pompeii more than 80 years after it was stolen by a Nazi officer during World War II.
title: Erotic ancient Roman mosaic looted by Nazi officer returned to Pompeii

author: Matt Lavietes
description: William "Rick" Singer, the mastermind of a nationwide college admissions cheating scheme, can work as a college consultant again so long as he discloses his criminal record to new clients, a federal judge ruled on Monday.
title: 'Varsity Blues' admissions scheme mastermind can advise college hopefuls again, judge rules

author: Ryan Nobles
description: A bipartisan duo is teaming up in the House to introduce a bill that would provide legal status for certain undocumented immigrants amid President Donald Trump’s broader mass deportation efforts.
title: Bipartisan duo introduces bill to give some migrant workers protected status amid Trump's crackdown

author: The Associated Press
description: DENVER — The murder trial of a Colorado dentist accused of killing his wife by poisoning her protein shakes and later trying to pay someone to kill the lead investigator on the case will begin with opening arguments Tuesday
title: Murder trial begins for Colorado dentist accused of poisoning wife's protein shakes

author: Alexander Smith
description: Trump's pledge of Patriot missiles to Ukraine and tariffs for Russia leaves some Europeans wary
title: Europeans are still wary of Trump's promises to Ukraine despite apparent U-turn on Putin

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Officials are continuing to investigate the cause of a fire at a Massachusetts assisted living facility that killed nine people and critically injured another.
title: Victims ID'd in Massachusetts assisted living facility fire that killed 9, cause under investigation

description: Harvey Guillén and Brenda Song will unveil the nominees. The awards show, hosted by comedian Nate Bargatze, will air on CBS on Sept.14.
title: Beloved new breakouts vie for Emmy nominations alongside popular returning shows

author: The Associated Press
description: A private spaceflight featuring the first astronauts in more than 40 years from India, Poland and Hungary came to a close Tuesday with a Pacific splashdown.
title: Private spaceflight ends with a Pacific splashdown for astronauts from India, Poland and Hungary

author: The Associated Press
description: Oregon's WNBA team stepped back in time for its new name, re-introducing the Portland Fire.
title: Expansion WNBA team brings back the original Portland Fire name

author: The Associated Press
description: The Trump administration on Monday took another step to make it harder to find major, legally mandated scientific assessments of how climate change is endangering the nation and its people
title: Trump administration says it won’t publish major climate change reports on NASA website

author: The Associated Press
description: Andrea Gibson, a celebrated poet and performance artist who through their verse explored gender identity, politics and their 4-year battle with terminal ovarian cancer, died Monday at age 49
title: Poet Andrea Gibson, candid explorer of life, death and identity, dies at 49

author: Bryanna Cappadona, TODAY
description: dumped from the villa before the finale dwindled down to four couples.
title: ‘Love Island USA’ Winners Amaya and Bryan React to Discovering They’ve Become TV Darlings

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: The East Coast was slammed with torrential rain and flash flooding on Monday that killed at least two people, turned streets into rivers, shut down subways, stranded drivers, and prompted water rescues
title: Two dead in severe storms and flash flooding on East Coast

description: Watch live coverage as the Senate Foreign Relations Committee holds a hearing to consider the nominations of several ambassadors, including Mike Waltz to serve as the ambassador to the United Nations. Waltz had previous served as the national security adviser for President Trump and had faced criticism for inadvertently adding a reporter to a Signal chat with administration officials about military strikes in Yemen.
title: Senate holds confirmation hearing for Mike Waltz to serve as U.N. ambassador

author: Jeff Cox, CNBC
description: Consumer prices rose in June as President Donald Trump’s tariffs began to slowly work their way through the U.S. economy
title: Inflation picks up again in June as tariffs slowly work their way through U.S. economy

author: Astha Rajvanshi
description: President Donald Trump may have expected a Russian shudder of fear to greet his threat of “very severe tariffs” on the country if it didn’t agree a ceasefire in Ukraine.
title: Russia unrattled after Trump's threat of 'very severe tariffs'

description: The Financial Times reports that President Donald Trump and Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy discussed whether long-range weapons could target Moscow. Now, the White House is responding to the report saying Trump was "merely asking a question, not encouraging further killing." It comes as the war between Russia and Ukraine has been unrelenting over the last 24 hours as Ukraine says Russia launched around 5,500 attacks. Now, Trump is giving Russian President Vladimir Putin 50 days to back do
title: WH Reacts to Report That Trump 'Encouraged' A Moscow Strike

author: Reuters
description: Daniel Martindale, a U.S. citizen who helped the Kremlin target troops in Ukraine, has received a Russian passport in Moscow.
title: U.S. citizen who helped Russia from inside Ukraine granted passport by Putin

description: Trump removed Waltz as national security adviser after he inadvertently added a journalist to a Signal discussion about military strikes in Yemen.
title: Mike Waltz to testify at Senate confirmation hearing for U.N. ambassador

description: A state of emergency was declared in New Jersey after severe storms slammed the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic, creating treacherous travel conditions and impacting flight schedules. NBC’s Erin McLaughlin reports for TODAY.
title: Severe Storms Slam Northeast and Mid-Atlantic

author: The Associated Press
description: STARKE, Fla. — A man who fatally shot a man and woman outside a Florida bar as part of an attempted revenge killing is scheduled to be executed on Tuesday
title: Florida man who killed 2 people outside a bar is scheduled to be executed

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Republican strategists want lawmakers to get specific when selling the “big, beautiful bill” to voters.
title: Texas officials defend flood response and Tucker Carlson criticizes Trump: Morning Rundown

author: Andrew Greif
description: Halfway through this Major League Baseball season, the hitter on a historic home-run pace is not Aaron Judge, the reigning American League MVP, nor Shohei Ohtani or Juan Soto, the sport’s $700 million sluggers
title: The month that turned Cal Raleigh into baseball’s best home-run hitter

author: Dylan Butts, CNBC
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang in recent months has ramped up his lobbying against export controls, arguing that they inhibited American tech leadership.
title: Nvidia says it will resume H20 AI chip sales to China ‘soon,’ following U.S. government assurances

author: Anniek Bao, CNBC
description: China’s economy grew at a faster-than-expected rate in the second quarter, keeping the country on track to meet its full-year target of 5% and easing some pressure on policymakers to step up stimulus to underpin growth
title: China’s second-quarter growth beats forecasts but deflation fears fuel calls for stimulus, deeper reform

author: Dylan Ebs
description: A former lawyer for the House committee that investigated the Jan.
title: Former Jan. 6 committee lawyer launches Democratic bid for Congress in Florida

author: Scott Wong
description: Democratic leaders have tried to squash impeachment pushes from rank-and-file lawmakers as progressives urge the party to fight harder against Trump.
title: Rogue Trump impeachment efforts divide House Democrats

author: Peter Nicholas
description: Democrats are poised to contest the Republican talking points about the "big, beautiful bill" at every turn, emphasizing the cuts to Medicaid.
title: 'Working families tax cut': Republicans look for new ways to sell the 'big, beautiful bill'

author: The Associated Press
description: The nearly century-old Grand Canyon Lodge in far northern Arizona was a refuge for ambitious hikers and adventurous tourists eager to bask in the magnificent views of one of the most remote and renowned landscapes in the world
title: The Grand Canyon Lodge was an elusive getaway for nearly a century. Now it's gone.

author: The Associated Press
description: Seattle's Cal Raleigh won his first All-Star Home Run Derby after leading the big leagues in long balls going into the break, defeating Tampa Bay's Junior Caminero 18-15 in the final round Monday night.
title: Seattle's Cal Raleigh becomes first catcher and switch-hitter to win Home Run Derby

author: Zoë Richards
description: Bozzuto Management sued the congressman for allegedly failing to pay $85,000 in rent between March and July. Mills said a faulty online payment link is to blame.
title: Landlord seeks to evict Republican congressman over unpaid rent at D.C. apartment

author: Phil Helsel
description: New Yorkers in basement apartments were told to be ready to leave and New Jersey’s governor declared a state of emergency after heavy rains in the northeast caused flash flooding, officials said
title: Flash flood warning issued for NYC, N.J. declares emergency as heavy rains soak area

description: Officials in Atlanta, Georgia, say hard drives containing unreleased music from Beyoncé were stolen from her choreographer's rental vehicle. NBC News' Priscilla Thompson has the details on the alleged theft, as the hard drives also included footage plans and future set lists for shows.
title: Unreleased Beyoncé music stolen in SUV break-in
